channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7678] make storefile management pluggable, together with compaction
item.summary: make storefile management pluggable, together with compaction

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: First, the actual patch. Since this depends on two more uncommitted jiras this won't apply for now.
Now temporary patch with dependencies for QA.
the name of the latter should say 7603, not 7604

+  public static final String STORE_ENGINE_KEY = "hbase.hstore.engine";

+

+  private static final Class<? extends StoreEngine>

+    DEFAULT_STORE_ENGINE_CLASS = DefaultStoreEngine.class;

I would expect STORE_ENGINE_KEY to be named consistently with the second key. How about naming it STORE_ENGINE_CLASS_KEY ?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12568126/HBASE-7678-with-7604-and-7773.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.
Please correct the 2 javadoc warning messages
javadoc warnings were actually in existing code. Rebased, fixed. Let me create an /r/

This is a big change. Do we have a design doc? It will be great if you can outline the purpose of the change, some design choices, the relationship among those entities such as StoreEngine, StoreFileManager, Compactor, CompactionPolicy, HStore, etc., how this change will be used for stripe/level compaction, and so on. Good stuff.

preliminary /r/ created at https://reviews.apache.org/r/9340/
I will be busy with something else most of the day today, probably; will create a writeup tomorrow.
There's some pre-writeup in the txt attached to HBASE-7519.

This message is automatically generated.

What do you think about moving the HStore.compact() code, or part of it, inside the StoreEngine? in this way you can have the compaction completely separated from the HStore and tests or CompactionTool can have a easier life to try a compaction.

I am thinking about it right now actually (how to avoid various casts between all 3 parts interacting).
With regard to compact(), HBASE-7725 might change CompactionRequest in a manner that would push this in the direction of encapsulating things into CompactionRequest (coprocs would subclass and produce CompactionRequest directly as far as I understand; so CompactionPolicy might as well do the same, and then it should be easy to change .compact(cr) to cr.execute and have the subclass do the right thing). I'd really like to avoid adding things to StoreEngine as it would make it more complicated to plug things (see the pdf).
canceling the patch while pdf is the latest file; will have to rebase for more than one issue anyway.
Rebase patch, allow objects to be created in one place in order to allow them to depend on each other.

minor test issue, due to allowing the start stripe to start anywhere now when first stripe is invalid the first key is not guaranteed to be chosen as open-key, so the set of files test provides depends on order, changed it
wait, that is wrong jira
